intro: Alyssum djurdjurae, commonly known as the Ethiopian alyssum, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Alyssum djurdjurae is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and hairy stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
